item.description: TREXO is an abstract strategy game in which players try to get five in a row of their symbol by placing tiles that contain both player symbols. Tiles can be placed anywhere on the 10x10 board, even on top of other tiles as long as they are placed on two different tiles that are at the same level.

item.description:
In the Name of Odin is a strategy game for 2-5 players, each with a claim to become the new Jarl. You are all brave warriors, shrewd traders and bold explorers, but only one of you will become the new Jarl to rule in the name of Odin!

During the game, each player expends action cards to construct new buildings in their village, gather companions, recruit famous Vikings, and build longships that will carry them to fame and glory.

item.description:
Welcome to the school for exceptionally talented students of the ancient art of Dungeon Crawling! Are you ready to make your House proud?

Dragonsgate College is a strategic game utilizing a unique dice-drafting mechanism that puts 2-4 players in charge of Student Houses locked in a battle for recognition and prestige. Each turn players draft dice that allow them to perform multiple actions: recruiting new apprentices and teachers, placing new facilities on their player boards, and more. Each turn they also have the opportunity to raise the general skill levels of their House, in order to give their apprentices a greater push towards performing feats of bravery and cunning.

Constructing student facilities, hiring seasoned adventurers as teachers, dabbling in the arcane arts of wizardry and subterfuge, and cleverly outmaneuvering your opponents - all this awaits you within the walls of this ancient university. Prove your worth, and maybe you will even get a tenure!

item.description:
Planetfall an explosive, fast paced game that brings ground-pounding, armoured combat to the ever-expanding Firestorm Galaxy.

In this deadly, hard sci-fi setting, hordes of futuristic tanks, agile aircraft and hulking mech-walkers tear each other asunder with high-powered weaponry. Lasers burn across the tabletop, rail-gun slugs smash through armoured hulls and advanced cyber-warfare weapons hack through vital systems – the war zones of the distant future are no place for the faint hearted.

Firestorm Planetfall puts you in the role of a Grand Commander, orchestrating the maneuvers of your chosen army. Each of your Battle Groups will contain several Helixes of stunningly-detailed 10mm scale miniatures, ranging from towering Leviathans to numerous bases of Infantry, all prepared to fight to the last under your command.

Your planetary invasion force will be formed of troops from one of the six core races, who in turn belong to one of two sides: the Zenian League or Alliance of Kurak, vast alliances currently fighting for dominance of the Galactic sector. Each of the six races has its own complex motivations within the conflict, as well as entirely unique vehicles and distinct ways of fighting their battles.


Firestorm Planetfall is a miniature tabletop wargame, set in the Firestorm Armada universe. The game uses 10mm miniatures and dice to reproduce future combat during planet invasion.

Firestorm Planetfall is a revised and updated version of Firestorm Invasion: Planetfall, with significant rules changes.

- Force construction is different and now uses the helix system, 
- Reinforced Target Zone markers were removed, 
- STAR cards were replaced by TACs (Tactical Action Cards), and - squadron activation no longer uses cards.

The helix system has also been blended into game play, in that you must activate every squadron within a helix before moving to another helix, and the turn structure is also different.

link.value: Firestorm Planetfall: Battle for Proteus Prime

item.description:
This game consists of a cardboard folder. The inner left leaf has the rules and a pocket holding eight cards with numbered horses. The inner right has a spinning wheel with 21 wedges of different size in either red or black, each with an instruction to either put money into the pot or take money out. The rules say tokens like matches or nuts can be used instead of money. The numbers 1 to 8 are printed around the wheel, each with a thin black line leading to the wheel.

One player starts in charge of the wheel. Players choose their horses in turn, starting from the left of that player. For each race, the player in charge of the wheel closes the folder, turns a thick cardboard disk on the back of the folder that is attached to the wheel inside, and then puts the folder back on the table and opens it. Each player looks at where his number lies on the wheel and follows the instructions for that wedge. Because of the layout of the wheel, the result for each horse will be different. If a horse's number is directly on a line, that player does nothing.

The wheel-spinning duty rotates around the table. The rules suggest that the spinning player's horse is out of each race. After the agreed number of races have been run, whatever remains in the spot is split equally, and the player with the most tokens wins. If the pot ever runs out of tokens, the game ends immediately.

This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2014/2015 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

Description from the box:
The game of Golf cannot be won, only played. Or so they say...Use a tip from your caddie, and wait for the wind to turn favorable so you can reach the green. 
Manage your clubs the best, and you could be the first to pocket your ball! It's easy:
1. Draw a golf club from the display or hit the ball to advance along the course
2. Spend your caddie tokens wisely to use the clubs special powers...
3. ...and try to pocket your ball using the fewest strokes possible to score the most victory points!

item.description:
From the box:
Join Sam and Dean in the epic struggle against evil, and race to end the war between Heaven and Hell with the Supernatural edition of Monopoly.

This is a Hot Topic Exclusive Release.

The adventure begins! Board the ship and visit every location in Rumini the brave little mouse's world! Fight the shark, shop in the bazaar of Pelevár, play poker in the Zsur Islands and reach three main ports before the others!

The game is based on the Hungarian writer Judit Berg's popular Rumini books. Before start the players are given different task sheets with the main locations they have to visit as quick as possible to win the game. Rolling three dice decides the direction and the distance the ships can go. All sorts of adventures are waiting for the sailors meeting dangers and friends which can be tackled with the help of some special cards. Good wind and well used tactics are all vital to reach first the final port...

name.value: Storming the Heights, The Battle of the Alma, Crimea 1854

item.description:
Storming the Heights, The Battle of the Alma, Crimea 1854 is a simulation of one of the first major battles of the Crimean War, fought on 20 September 1854. This game models for the first time in a highly-playable format the key elements of the battle — command control (lack of generalship), weaponry, and tactical formations — and aims to captivate players with its strikingly beautiful period map and counters designed by graphic artist, Terry Leeds.

GAME CONTENTS

• One 22" x 34" full-color, period-style map sheet
• One 1/2” full-color counter sheet
• One 5/8” full-color counter sheet
• One 3/4” wide full-color counter sheet
• Rules booklet with Designer’s Notes
• Two Player Aid Cards
• One 6-sided and one 10-sided die
• Boxed

GAME SCALE

Time: 30 minutes per turn
Map: 300 meters per hex
Units: infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries
Complexity: Low to Moderate
Playing Time: 3–5 Hours
Number of Players: 1–2

Now available for preorder from Consim Press

Aristotle’s Stairway abstractly portrays the philosophical pursuit of human excellence, of achieving “perfect being” as envisioned by the famous ancient Greek thinker Aristotle. Players roll dice and make important decisions, developing their powers of Reason, Ethics, Wisdom, Virtue and sense of Well Being while gaining various Insights along the way. The player who becomes more fully enlightened (gains the most Insight Points) will ultimately triumph – and win the game!

Generally, players will randomly select and roll three dice and use two of them to move their playing pieces up five colored columns -- sometimes taking scoring markers (IPs) -- until they reach one of the top spaces of each column. Some markers allow special modifications to a die roll. The game ends when one player has climbed all five "stairways" and thus has maximized all five powers as noted above.

Playable in 30 minutes, Aristotle’s Stairway is a cerebral, two-player filler with dice-rolling, tough decisions – and, with several catch-up mechanisms – usually results in a hotly contested, down-to-the-wire game!

For hundreds of years, humanity has been traveling through far galaxies. Many centuries ago humans encountered other sentient – yet alien – races, but only Kalmians were as aggressive and as technologically advanced as the descendants of the inhabitants of Earth. In the remote outer rim of the universe Tellurians and Kalmians keep fighting in their spaceships for domination. In those fierce and deadly skirmishes only a few things really count: commanders’ skills to maneuver huge astral vessels, the ability to foresee your opponent’s next move as well as wise management of energy in different ship sectors and proper assignment of power to shields and laser cannons.

Only one ship shall leave this accursed vastness of space, while the burnt-out wreck of its rival shall remain here as a warning to all enemies or a prized loot for lucky scrappers...

Outer Rim is a simple and quick, science-fiction battle game for two players. One player commands the starship of Tellurians, while the other player becomes the captain of the star vessel belonging to the alien race of Kalmians. Players wage a deadly duel in the cosmic space. Victory depends on proper allocation of energy around the starship, a little luck when rolling dice and smart use of special abilities of modules and crews.

The battle ends when one of the starships has two sectors destroyed. The commander of such vessel loses and his opponent wins!

Name That...! Person, Place, Thing... is a quick thinking name game. Play individually or in teams.

Roll the dice in the dice unit, and write answers in the category shown in the center die that start with each of the letters shown on the outer dice. Only unique answers score points. Multiple word answers starting with the same letter score extra points.

36 categories on 3 category dice, plus 6 letter dice.

Note: This is not the same as Name That...! Person, Place, Thing..., even though it has the same name, and was published in the same year, by the same publisher.

item.description:
Carnivores, winner of the 2015 Best Combinatorial Game Award, is a 2 player strategy game where players control and evolve predatory species in a food web. They try to eat one another, and the player whose Carnivores fully expand into their ecosystem or eat a certain amount of flesh first wins.

The Carnivores in the game take the form of polyhexes on a hexagonal board, and a "Circle of Life" surrounding the board indicates which Carnivores can eat which.

Players evolve their Carnivores bit by bit, evolving them to take advantage of the food supply around them. But every evolutionary step also opens a species to predation from some other species. As a result players must navigate a perilous balance between aggression and self-protection to win.

Despite elementary rules, the game captures key dynamics of real food webs. For example:


 the ecosystem starts with simple organisms, which evolve into more complex ones over time.
 evolutionarily simple species reproduce at higher rates than more complex ones, but also tend to have shorter lives and die in greater numbers.
 when the population of one species is high, it drives up the population of the species that eats it.
 species' complexity rises as you go up the food chain, but when a species at the top of the chain dies, it feeds back into the bottom. 


Official Rules

item.description:
A fun and simple family board game. Each player gets two secret missions to save animals. These missions correspond to two specific tiles on the board. The goals are achieved by wisely using the set of actions available.

In his turn, a player plays one of his Action card and does the action described on the card. These actions consist of moving one or more tiles on the board, either up (Card+), down (cards-) or by switching two tiles (Switch cards).

A round can end either when a tile reaches the highest level or when all players have played all their Action cards.

Each player then reveals his two Mission cards and scores the number of points corresponding to the tiles drawn on each of his Mission cards

A stock-holding micro game.

At start, all players will get the same amount of "price" card and "Merchandise" card, all cards present 5 merchandises in a combination of 2 kinds.

Players trade their hand cards until someone runs out his hand cards. Players multiplies the merchandises on their hand cards and traded cards by the merchandises on "ALL" price cards, who got most points wins!

item.description: Falling Stars: The Red Line is a tactical turn-based starship combat game set in Distant Sector of the Galaxy, where the last remnants of humanity fight for control of their future. Players choose a faction in Falling Stars, then assemble Star Fleets of customized Star Ships and engage in objective or mission driven space battles. Great war machines blast away in orbit of coven worlds, or in the vast dark of interstellar space. Explore uncharted systems in search of new riches or strategic advantages, all in an attempt to prevent the light of humanity from being swallowed up in the black of space.”

Fire Team: Red Eclipse is a new tactical system. Fire Team: Red Eclipse covers the Cold War Gone HOT in West Germany in the late 1980's and early 1990's. Fire Team: Red Eclipse is designed and developed by Steve Overton with Jon Southard, designer of the original Fire Team game, consulting and graphic design by Shayan Logan

Fire Team: Red Eclipse covers the US and Soviet forces fight on geomorphic maps that are represented at about 50-meter hexes and 2 - 5-minute turns.

Fire Team: Red Eclipse brings together mechanics to represent the OODA Loop, training and experience of military organizations, Command and Control of tactical combat units, random impulses based on the capabilities of your leaders on the map, intuitive game play based on the units responding to game play as soldiers do in actual situations, and the ability to create random events such as happen in small unit actions.

Couple the OODA Loop with the training and experience of each nations organizations in the series to create a unique blend of Command and Control with organizational traits. Tactical Event Cards add additional options for play, Command Points give you a varying number of orders per impulse - determined by the quality and condition of the leaders you currently have in play on the map. As the overall leader in the game, you can do whatever you want. You just won't be able to do it all at the same time. If one of your Command Point chits is drawn, you will have between 1 and three orders to issue. Those orders range from firing at the enemy to repairing support weapons and everything in between. That's all great but which orders do you give 'RIGHT NOW'? Each of us has a different idea about what's the most important thing to do at any given moment.

Leaders play the pivotal role in the game by creating orders, directing fire, providing a movement bonus, and assisting in rallying of broken/disrupted units. The state of your leaders on the map determines how many orders they can give each impulse during the turn. The organization of the nationality you have determines the number of orders you may get in an impulse. The player who can utilize his leaders to the greatest effect will usually be the winner. Usually, because nothing is ever 100% certain in Kontact Now.

Weaponry has not been left out of the game. All weapons of the era are in the game. All weapons systems in the series have been created using the same formulas. This allows each unit - weapons system - to be created with it's own unique values in relation to the other weapons of that same weapons class over the past 70+ years and into the future. Armor penetration values are constant throughout the series as are armor defensive values; for all vehicles and helicopters. Each weapons class has been exhaustively researched to give you the best unit values to work with. You don't have to worry about the weapons and the systems. All you have to worry about is using them in a winning combination.

Fire Team: Red Eclipse will include Off-Map Artillery, night rules, engineer obstacles (mines, wire, bunkers, trenches), multi-level buildings, rubble, fires, roadblocks, helicopter, Close Air Support (CAS), Antitank Guided Missiles, Surface to Air Missiles, Man Portable Air Defense systems, with both high and low unit counter density scenarios, exiting the map, all of varying degrees of complexity. Special rules governing helicopter and column movement activation, as well as snipers, medics, wounded and vehicles with multiple weapons systems.

Asymmetrical Victory Conditions combined with the Tactical Event Cards and concealment counters, random CAS attack packages, random size artillery missions, and Opportunity Fire adds a heavy layer of Fog of War to the system.

Because of the random chit draw for each impulse during a turn, the series is extremely solitaire friendly.

KN very much adheres to the chaos gaming method. This is not an "I take a turn/ You take a turn" game. This is random events, varying length impulses per turn, surprises at every moment kind of a game with an intuitive set of rules. It is not so random that you have nothing to do but sit back and let the game play itself. The choices are there every impulse for the gamer to impact game play. Tactical Event Cards can be played at any time, no matter whose impulse it is. Game play gets so intense that the gaming table may crack!!

Good Hunting.

There are 3 number dice and 52 cards with bigger numbers.
Just draw the card, roll the dice and do the math so that you are the first who make correct calculations according to the card.
At the end of the game who have the most cards is the winner.

This is the fastest, most accurate basketball game on the market today. Zone and man-to-man defenses are your options. You become coach and player at the same time. Learn to recognize all types of offenses and defenses as you try to outscore your opponent. A mobile spinner decides your position on the court - you determine your game strategy. Both offensive & defensive rebounds occur; shots are blocked and shots are made, fouls are committed and foul shots are taken; you may take the hook shot, jump shot, or set shot and you may dribble, pass or shoot. A scoreboard is provided for score, quarters, and time outs. You determine your own defense and what offense to use against your opponent. Call the shots yourself when you play Advantage Basketball. (from brochure)

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the court, the detailed playbook and strategy.

From the publisher:
This educational game depicts the actual high-speed excitement of the world's fastest sport. It is perfect for the beginner and advanced player or fan. All the strategic moves and fast action of hockey are provided for you. You can pass, skate or shoot - slapshot, wrist shot or backhand. Penalties can be called against you, and you can use the power play when your opponent is penalized. A scoreboard is provided for goals, periods and penalty time. The board play simulates every kind of action just like a real game on the ice. You create your own strategy and action.

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the ice, the detailed playbook and strategy.

name.value: Advantage: Tennis – The Game of Singles

item.description:
The most complete detailed game of singles ever created. Designed to provide great entertainment while teaching all the basic fundamentals of the game. A mobile spinner decides your position on the court - you determine your game strategy. Advantage, Tennis is perfect for every level of competition, from beginner to expert. You serve, lob, volley and smash to strategic points on the court. You play backcourt and net. You hit and return shots from every spot on the court. Keep score by point, game and set - even tie-breakers. A booklet of rules, illustrated shots, court diagrams, and other instructional material is provided.(from brochure)

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the court, the detailed playbook and strategy.

name.value: Angry Town: The Fighting Card Game

item.description:
Angry Town is a 2 player head-to-head dueling card game loosely based on the mechanics of fighting games. In Angry Town players will choose from 8 different Fighters all with their own unique ability that gives them an edge over their opponent. Players will be able to do amazing combos, build a Meter and BLAST their opponent away all in the hopes to become the new Mayor of Angry Town.

It is Election Season in Angry Town, but instead of the boring stuff like voting, debates and fundraisers the candidates enter the Mayoral Tournament, and FIGHT for the chance to challenge the current Mayor, who has been Mayor for over fifty years. The winner becomes the new Mayor and has absolute power.

Players will choose one of the 8 Fighters: a Ninja Howler Monkey, a Failed Martial Artist Bum, a Quack Doctor, an Angry Nerd, a Demented Girl Scout, the Don of the Baby Mafia, a Luchador Rabi, and an Irish Catholic Nun who knows over 87 ruler based attacks. Each Fighter's play style is simple to learn but challenging to master, but once mastered you will be one step closer to achieving ultimate power!

There are 2 Modes of Play: "Classic Mode" (2 Player head-to-head), and "Tag Team Mode" (2 Player head-to-head with 2 or 3 Fighters each).

Are you ready to fight? In that case, Welcome to Angry Town, where everyone is happy, happy to kick your ass and stomp you into the ground!

Src:Card is a standalone 1-2 player (2-4 with expansion) card game that challenges players to build their own super robot core while attacking their opponent by writing code. Make your robot core as formidable as possible while creating code to attack and anticipate changes to your opponent's network. Src:Card is made for anyone interested in programming who has a love of gaming. Birthed from a love of German style boardgames, computer strategy games and too much time programming, Src:Card incorporates real coding concepts that are challenging for experts and easy to learn for beginners.

In Src:Card players have statement (method, bug and structure) cards and cybernetic core cards in their hand throughout the game. At the beginning of a turn a player will draw a new card. A player has the opportunity to harden the core of his/her robot's cybernetic core by adding nodes and firewall components. Each player must balance increased strength attributes against the vulnerabilities that new core cards present. Each player desires to harden his/her robot's core as much as possible while delaying the eight card "boot-up" threshold.

At the same time, players are creating code using actual programming items to defeat their opponent's super robot. The placement of different loops, varying conditional statements and a multitude of functions allows each player to create dynamic, ever changing instructions of attack against their opponent. All components can be nested and with the addition of expansion packs, new functions and additional players are added to the game.

When a player has passed the 8-card "boot-up" threshold, their robot is alive and is open to attack from its opponents. Should an opponent defeat your robot, they will be victorious. However should you do the same, you will neutralise the threat of that nation’s super robot and claim victory for your realm!

item.description:
Use The New Rock, Paper, Scissors Mechanic To Score!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Elemental Battle, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win.

This 4th entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a rock, paper, scissors mechanic that works with SIX elemental icons for a whole new dimension to the game. You also get 11 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect elemental battle shards into your ACTIVE area, then use them to battle your opponents through ONE of THREE battle actions. You can CAPTURE their ACTIVE battle shards into your SCORE area, MOVE their ACTIVE battle shards to your ACTIVE area, or TRANSFER battle shards from their SCORE areas to the general SUPPLY area, accessible to all players. Don’t worry… you can still pass your bad karma to other players. It wouldn’t be Karma Crystals without Karma Crystals!

You will either roll or battle on each turn. Roll dice to match with a monster elemental card and collect elemental battle shards that match your dice into you ACTIVE area, or battle to score shards. If you score 11 or more elemental battle shards, that triggers the end the game and a winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - the 96 elemental battle shards are all you need to battle your opponents and build your score.

Score Game Points As The Swarm Surrounds You, Or Escape!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Swarm, your bestactic is to collect that bad karma now and swarm your opponents with karma crystals to get the win.

This 5th entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a zombie swarm type of game mechanic and a set of boards used to maneuver it against other players to win. You also get 10 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect elemental shards and karma crystals from the swarm, but be careful. You are limited on attacks against them. Use the swarm for your benefit, but don’t be caught by it as other players use it against you!

As you build your collection of elemental shards and karma crystals, you can trigger the end of the game, but be careful not to do this before you are sure of the win.

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 45 minutes to play depending on the number of players. No paper score cards and pencil needed. Your game score is determined by the number of elemental shards and karma crystals you score.

Welcome to the assembly of darkness!

In Dark Assembly, you become a member of the Diet of the world of darkness and receive tributes from supporters. Also, you earn money if you sell them on the black market. However, the VIPs controlling the assembly will require players to pay tributes to them.

In the town where have spiteful intentions, how much money may you get? In the world of darkness, you can do various thing, such as defying the VIPs.

Dark Assembly is a worker placement game that can also be played in solitaire mode.

item.description:
Kender Du Typen? is based on the Danish DR TV-show of the same name.

In the game, players try to become the best lifestyle expert, by answering various questions.
The questions in the game are divided into two categories: questions about how well you know your friends, and general questions about lifestyles.

Big Brain Bang makes it possible to peek inside the human brain to see what happens there. Together with the other players, you take on the roles of competing thoughts that seek to take control of as many neurons as possible. A brain model built of cardboard neuron network tiles will appear right on your gaming table. By the end of the game, the owner of the biggest network wins!

Dark Frontier is a space battle game with more than 200 different cards, where brave captains face each other for conquering the Galaxy.

The development team of Dark Frontier has been working for more than three years to achieve an unique card game, in which you will find:

- The Campaign Manual. A 252 pages book with the history of Dark Frontier, the backstory of our six factions, three thousand years of human history, a poster of the galaxy, and three complete ways for playing Dark Frontier. All this content can be downloaded for free on PDF!

- Three playing modes for competitive and casual players:
Through Campaign Mode you will experience the history of Dark Frontier in more than thirty replayable scenarios, both solo or versus another player. 
In Duel Mode , normal or narrative, you will confront your friends or tournament enemies to obtain victory through conquest or destruction of a planet. 
In Multiplayer Mode, you will enjoy frenzied games or political discussions for three players or more. This mode can also be played against the AI as a team.

- Six different victory or defeat conditions. Colonize the galaxy, gather crystals, destroy either enemy’s spaceship or planet, or make your opponents abandon their mission.

- A 140 pages graphic novel, tying the history of this first Dark Frontier set with the upcoming mini set, whose development is already finished and will be released for free during the next campaign.

The boxset content is designed to be halfway between a TCG and a LCG: is a collectible game without any random boosters. Boxsets contain all game cards, thus eliminating chance and extra costs for the player.

Choose your spaceship, select your mission, build your deck and plan your strategy to win the game!!

The contents of Dark Frontier Starter Box is:

1 rulebook

248 cards:

 Orders cards (red back): 80 cards
 Army cards (blue back) 165 cards
 Spaceship cards (green back): 3 cards




47 cardboard markers:

 3 colonization area markers
 3 crystal markers
 31 square markers
 10 triangular markers

item.description:
City States is a board game depicting Ancient Greece and its' city states during the Classical until the Pre-hellenistic era.
Each round

At the start of each round, players are dealt historical personalities from each period like Leonidas, Pericles, Pausanias, Themistocles etc. Each such historical figure is attached to a specific city state.

Their role remains hidden as they secretly lay out plans during the round, beneficial for their city state (for example, fortify a city, build or improve temples, barracks etc. train/recruit soldiers) or detrimental to other city states like sabotage, war, espionage etc.

At the end of the round, all plans are revealed and resolved. Players gain victory points accordingly.

The winner of the game is the player with the most victory points.

The ancient Greek world was ruled by the Olympian gods, 12 beings of immense power, but also victims to their own feelings, passions and vices.
They vied for supremacy very often even amongst themselves, sometimes through brute force like hurling bolts of lightning, but they also conspired against each other through guile and intricate machinations.
This is the game the gods were playing when they tried to consolidate their power by working in the shadows, manipulating mortals to do their bidding, either showering them with promises of immortality and other divine gifts, or bending them to their will with dreadful threats and curses. The gods would compete against each other in a contest of wits and tactics, having the heroes of ancient Greece face mythical creatures and threats and gain glory in their name.

Deus ex Machina is a competitive game for 2 to 4 players with an innovative hero placement mechanism in which each player takes the role of an Olympian god trying to achieve supremacy over the other gods via manipulation of heroes and behind the scenes planning. Their ultimate goal is to accumulate the most Glory Points by having heroes complete quests. The winner of the game is the player who has completed his secret objective.

item.description:
Ironclad is a cooperative space opera game for 1 to 3 players.

Ironclad's story driven campaign puts you in the far future of our world, in the midst of a Cosmic Cold War era between various galactic spanning factions like the Gaia Nova Federation, the Galactic Council etc.

Players are freelancers aboard the Ironclad, a powerful battleworn warship that defected from the Gaia Nova Federation Navy. They will be tasked with completing missions for various factions from smuggling and collecting bounties to destroying formidable battle space stations or taking part in massive space battles.

In Ironclad players collectively control the battleship through its vital Sections (Bridge, Weapons and Hangar) by assigning Heroes and follow a campaign of 10+ scenarios. Each scenario will feature certain points where players will be called to make a choice. These choices will have benefits and/or repercussions within the current game and also on future scenarios played. Thus, with each passing scenario the story unfolds according to the choices made by the players.

Players will have to make sure that their ship and her systems remain intact, while also paying attention to the Crew and their Morale. Ironclad is designed to provide players with a challenging game and a highly replayable campaign. Players may very well lose during the course of the campaign as they are learning the game. In order to emerge victorious, players will need to customize their Hero Roster and upgrade their Battleship according to the challenges they expect to face, as well as work together to overcome the dangers that lie ahead.

Each mission uses the modular hexagonal board pieces to set up the space sector where the scenario takes place. Players have to reach their goal (they may also attempt to discover secret objectives that might lie in-between). During their journey they will encounter threats ranging from other hostile ships (pirates, warmongers etc.), while braving cosmic anomalies (like solar flares or black holes).

Ironclad features:

 Narrative driven campaign with missions that will provide players with over 15 hours of content.
 Hexagon based modular map tiles representing space stations, planets, cosmic events and the vastness of space.
 A.I. controlled threats and events (enemy ships and cosmic events)
 Customizable and upgradeable Battleship.
 A variety of unique Heroes to choose from for each scenario.

item.description:
For the casual fan and the football addict! The Red Zone is a well balanced fast paced football game that allows novice and experienced football fans to feel the excitement of Pro football. With a balance of strategy and luck, the experienced player can play wisely to put the odds in their favor, but it won't always guarantee the victory.

Two teams can go head to head in a single game or multiple players can set up a league to see who will be The Red Zone champion!

Choose what plays to run and how to utilize your star players at crucial times. Will you run the ball for a shorter but surer gain? Will you pass the ball inside and outside to throw the defense off? Or perhaps you're a risk taker who likes to throw the long bomb!

Knowing your opponents tendencies, calling the right plays and managing the clock could be the difference between winning and losing the championship!

Both teams will be engaged on every play as you battle it out in this classic, fast-paced game of head-to-head football. As time begins to run out, you may be forced to change your strategy to save precious seconds on the clock. It won't be easy, the defense wants to force you to keep the clock moving!

Use the stat sheets provided to keep track of rival matches, league records, sacks, and other stats for personal records and bragging rights.

In Nadaras, players start as faction leader planning their perilous journey to Nadaras, a mechanical island mysteriously appeared in the middle of the ocean. Every attempt to establish an outpost on its metal shores failed and just one survivor returned, telling tales of horror ad riches beyond imagination. The Emperor himself tasked the bravest and most resourceful nobles to claim the island in his name with the promise of eternal power and glory.

To win the game you have to develop your faction according to several different aspects: military power, territory, knowledge, fame and influence over the imperial court. To fulfil this objective players have to explore the island and exploit its resources to support the growth of their settlement and armies. The resources are found on tiles that are randomly spread across the game board.
Turn by turn you have the opportunity to make wondrous scientific discoveries or exploit the natural magic of the island to unlock new structures for your settlement or units for your army. Exceptionally gifted individuals, heroes, will become your field agents, discovering the deepest and darkest secrets of this island.
Conflicts over territory or resources are common between factions and, far from imperial supervision, what really matters is the end not the means to reach it. The island itself, however, reacts to human presence, trying to reestablish order by cleansing the land from all living beings.

What pathway will you choose to become the Emperor’s favorite? Force, wealth, fame or knowledge?

Will you cultivate science or rediscover lost magic?

All this and much more is Nadaras!

item.description:
Gaslands is a game of post-apocalyptic vehicular mayhem.

Gaslands is a tabletop wargame of car-on-car destruction in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Players form a racing team, and compete for money and fame, scrapping in between races for the resources they need for the next race.

Movement consists of movement templates and custom "skid dice" to create a fluid and madcap game.

Gaslands was the winner of both the Judges' Choice and People's Choice awards for Best New Miniatures Rules at the UK Games Expo 2018.

item.description:
Sneeze is all about staying as healthy as possible while making sure that you're not too healthy and that everyone else has more infections than you. Be infected and infect others.

It's not good enough to simply get rid of all your germs. Players have to strategically infect themselves and cure themselves and others to win.

The last player who is not too sick wins. For three or more players, a player is too sick once infected with five different colored infections. While a too sick player can't win the game, he or she continues to play and infect other players.

This revised edition of Die Siedler von Catan: Junior includes the new rules of Catan Junior Madagascar.

It plays two to four players, rather than three to four. The new board is printed on both sides. One side for two players (new) and the other side is for 3-4 players.

Changes from earlier versions:

- new board
- 2 gold islands (old: 1)
- 5 life rings on the board (old: market)
- no Harbour tiles (old: 4)
- generally all Tokens (old: cards)
- resource pineapple (old: rum)
- new colours lilac and bright yellow (old: White and yellow/orange)
- parrot as robber (old: pirate)

---

Die Siedler von Catan: Junior is a junior edition of The Settlers of Catan. Players collect and trade resources in order to build things, gain more resources and score points. The first player to build seven warehouses wins.

item.description:
It's hard being a cult leader. Your underlings are incompetent, madness is eminent and a good sacrifice is hard to find. If you can avoid your competitors tricks and stave off insanity maybe the stars will align and you will summon an old one.

Cultists & Cthulhu is an fast, humorous, "take that" style card game in which you want to complete the Ritual card in front of you. The card has both a Success value and a Ritual value; using Cultists cards, you roll dice to try to meet or exceed the Success value. When you do, you collect the Ritual (and the points). The first player to complete 21 points worth of Rituals is the winner. Sacrifices, Books and other cards can add to your roll, while Tentacle, Insanity, and other cards can take away.

The strategy cardgame based on historical novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". Many characters represent by cards. "Sangokushi Haou" is means the Champion of the Three Kingdoms.

Players control one of five warlords. In each turn, player can perform three actions in the order specified: attack a province, draw one card and reorganization in own provinces.
The battle is resolve three steps: stratagem, duel and army combat. These affected by characters.

Winner determined by victory points, mostly gain from control of provinces.

name.value: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Scout vs. Grenadier

item.description:
From the publisher:

Grab a Mech and get to fighting... fast! Based on the free-to-play FPS, HAWKEN, you will pilot a Mech with the goal of knocking out your opponent's Mech. In Hawken: Real-Time Card Game, your deck of cards contains primary and secondary weapons systems, thrusters, special abilities, and various other high-tech instruments of war. Draw cards and place them onto the table as fast as you can, but be careful or you might overheat! The action is in real-time, but a game round ends when a player snags the FIRE! button from the center of the table. Quick reflexes are helpful, but a quick mind will win every time!

link.value: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Sharpshooter vs. Bruiser

item.description: It is 1916, and the First World War continues with no end in sight. With the war a bloody stalemate on the ground, the combatants have turned to their developing air forces to achieve victory. Wings for the Baron allows 3-5 players to take the role of German aeroplane manufacturers, supplying the machines needed to drive the Allied air forces from the skies and ensure German victory. Compared to the first edition it features expanded and streamlined rules, a fifth player, an advanced game featuring reconnaissance and bomber aeroplane development.

item.description:
Description from the official website:

"Do Men Really Know Women is a game that will reveal who knows the most about the other sex. The ultimate battle between the sexes. The 2 teams, men and women, must show their strength in categories that belong to the world of the opposite sex :

Men: Fashion, Home, Personal Care, Chick Flicks Women: Hobby & Engineering, Transportation, Sports, Movies

…And women must bet on what they think is typically men and men have to bet on what they think turns on women – and vice versa. All very interesting questions that might result in surprising answers!"

Bet on what your friends would do in fun, embarrassing and uncomfortable situations. 
On your turn, you are given a dilemma and have to chose, from three options, what you would do in that situation.
The other players must then guess on what you would do, and the ones that are correct will advance on the scoring track.

Fast-Paced Tactical Starship Combat Card Game

In the late part of the 21st century Mankind is fighting for domination of the resources of his solar system.

In this card game of star ship fleet combat, 2 players select ships cards and play weapons/tactics cards in furious, and fast-paced action!

There are prepared scenarios and random battles and players can design their own scenarios as well. Play is fast and clean and easy! A good game for a short evening of starship combat fun!


 Spacecraft range from small frigates, destroyers, cruisers, light & heavy cruisers, fighter carriers, dreadnaughts and battleships.



 Weapons range from turbo lasers, rail guns, and drones, to torpedoes and boarding parties.



 Each game is placed in a battlefield setting from planetary rings, asteroid fields, star bases, open space, etc. Each battlefield type has specific but simple rules for combat.



 8 "Historical" scenarios follow the great Solar Civil War! The Scenario booklet can be downloaded separately as a PDF in "downloads" below (after purchase of the game).



 Simple ship value-point system for keeping score.



 Dice rolling for weapons fire and tactics resolution.

item.description:
The four most respected members of the tribe, the Chief, Hunter, Maiden and Shaman, have come together, each seeking the favor of the Great Spirit. To win that favor, each must perform a ritual dance, with the best dance earning the desired divine favor.

Mahola is a card game for 3 to 4 players themed around the beautiful dances of the Native American culture. Players will draw, play, and pass cards in order to create the highest scoring dance and win a favor token. The first to win 3 tokens wins the game.

item.description: The bunnies hop from nest to nest and deliver their easter eggs. Movement ist determined by a color-die. The first bunny to deliver an egg to every of the 12 nests wins the game.

Dynamite comes in a very small package in this super-deformed, gem-infused fighting card game.

Pocket N30N City RUMBLE is a dueling card game that simulates colossal battle between teams of tiny street fighters. Players use 3 Fighters to perform a wide array of attacks, combos, counters, and super moves to beat the living gems out of the opponent(s).

Discover your power team by playing solo at the "Dojo" and surprise your friends with newfound skills during your next Tag Team match!

In the game it comes to celebrities. For every famous head features must be represented and guessed. You even have to convey these features your team. You may paint, show a pantomime or talk. But you have 60 seconds each time - for five terms

Based on the public domain game known as Celebrities.

Los jugadores encarnan a agentes de la Interpol que persiguen a los miembros de la banda SCOP por todo el mundo. Para ello dependeran de sus conocimientos culturas de los distintos paises por lo que el criminal va pasando en su huida. Ademas cuando le atrape debera tenerle correctamente identificado.
Ganara aquel jugador que requiera del menor tiempo posible para detener a sus objetivos.

Sistema de juego:
Los jugadores pueden Buscar pista o Viajar.
- Buscar pista: Los jugadores pueden investigar en las diferentes localizaciones de pais donde se encuentran. En esa localizacion le daran pistas sobre el paradero del criminal. Las pistas vienen en forma de costumbres o cultura del pais de destino. Adicionalmente, el jugador puede obtener informacion sobre las caracteristicas del sospechoso. Esta accion tiene un coste de 1 unidad de tiempo.
- Viajar: Cuando el jugador cree conocer donde se esconde el criminal va a ese pais. Luego se comprueba si estaba en lo correcto o equivocado. Esta accion tiene un coste variable dependiendo de la distancia recorrida.
Los jugadores en cada ronda deben recorrer 4 paises para atrapar al sospechoso y para ello disponen de 4 dias.


Players are Interpol agents that must arrest to the members of the CSOD criminal band. For this, they need a lot of knowledge about the countries for the suspect be in his flee.
When the player cath the suspect he must identify him correctly.
The player who need less time to catch his objetives win the game.

Gameplay:

During the game the players can search clues or Travel.
- Search clues means that players investigate in the actual place in one location. This location give to the player a clue about the next destination where the criminal. The clue is about culture of the country where the criminal is. In addition the player can get information about the characteriscts of the suspect. This action cost 1 unit time.
- Travel means that the player knows where the criminal is hideway and go to the country. Then looks that his correct or wrong. This action cost variable time units depend of the distance.
To catch the criminal each round tha player must travel throught 4 countries and He has 4 days to arrest.

Review by Time for Kids:

"The search for Waldo began 25 years ago. So, where is he? As fans of the books know, Waldo is a master of hiding in plain sight. Now the hunt continues in the Where’s Waldo? Join the Search board game from Techno Source. Arrange the eight game cards in any order, spin the wheel, flip a playing card and race to find the hidden objects on the card. Get your eagle eyes ready: The player with the most cards wins! – Kelli Plasket"

From the publisher:

Where's Waldo? Join the Search Game is fun for the whole family. Join your friends in a race to find to find the hidden objects in this board game featuring the Waldo and his friends. The super detailed scenes are right out of the beloved picture books by Martin Handford. Arrange the game boards in any order. Then spin the wheel, flip a card, and you're off! Fans of the Where's Waldo books will recognize the colorful characters from the Waldo universe. And if you're meeting Waldo for the first time, you'll be amazed at all the ways he can hide in plain sight. Includes an adjustable game board with 12 double-sided tiles, cards, spinner, and game tokens. The game offers a new game experience every time you play. You'll even receive two Where's Waldo postcards with classic book scenes. Fun for 2 - 6 players age 8 and over. University Games offers you and your family a wide selection of creative games that are easy to learn and fun to play.

On a distant planet, a lonely God peers over his barren domain. "If only there was an Other."
In that instant, a new race was born, perfect in mind body, and spirit. This new race, the Magi, had awesome powers and could control the elements of Earth, Fire, and Water. 
They even manipulated the weather and the fabric of Space-Time.

Preferring the company of each other, the God sent a curse to the planet and attempted to destroy his "failed" experiment. A bloody battle breaks out between groups of these Magi.

Take control of an army of powerful Magi and arrange a battlefield to take advantage of elemental and tier advantages during the bloody battles where strategy, luck, chaotic effects, spells and d6 rolls decide who comes out on top.

A rich variety of spells with effects that range from buffing a Magi to damaging your foe's Magi, stealing their spells, even rearranging their battlefield. A few are powerful enough to resurrect a dead Magi!

Beware! When you have defeated your enemies to be the last one standing, the angry God will descend to the planet to battle you!

Prevent his attempt to eradicate your existence!

This race to the end board game is based on the popular card game Lost Heir, which was based on the 1872 novel, The Lost Heir of Linlithgow by the widely-read 19th century author, Mrs. Emma Dorothy Eliza Nevitte Southworth (commonly referred to as E.D.E.N. Southworth).

The game comes with a spinner, playing pieces and game board, with spaces featuring characters along the outer edge of the board that look like the pictures on the card game. These spaces give instructions for the players to go to another character, move forward or back, lose a turn, etc. The winner is the player who lands, by exact count, on The Heir space in the middle.

Sukkube is an abstract game in which each player represents a character of the circus: The Tamer, the Lion, the Presenter, the Clown, the Strong Man, and the Dancer. If fewer than six players are in the game, assign the remaining positions to the "bots", which will play automatically.

They are distributed, discoveries, five cards to each character.
The cards are played according to the rules.
These cards allow to rotate the cube, which is nothing other than the box itself of the game.

When any character ends his cards, or can not play any according to the rules, the round ends and the character on the upper face of the cube (the Dominator) earns a point. You rotate the cube of 180 degrees and the character that was at the bottom end of the previous round (the Sukkube) is the first to play in the new run. First player to reach 5 points Wins.

The game will test the predictive power of the players, having played all cards on the table.

Seven play variants let you experience different moods.

Ophiuchus is composed by 27 title cards and 13 cards representing the 13 constellations.

Players, in turn, will place a card next to another card in order to form horizontal or vertical sequences of symbols corresponding to the drawings on the constellation cards. The goal of the game is to accumulate more points than other players.

item.description:
The game is based on Ludo. The aim of the players is to feed their dinosaurs.
Two players have 4 herbivorous dinosaurs and two other players have a carnivorous dinosaur. Winner of the game is the player who first had 6 tokens with food and return to their lair with all the pieces.
Herbivores collect tokens by bypassing the round by the board and return it to its lair. Carnivorous dinosaurs get a token every time you step on the same field with another dinosaur.

item.description:
Next One is game like bluff and chicken race.
Players turn over chips and get VP or dead(lose game).
The player who more VP get win this game.

In each turn, players can 2 actions.
 1. Turn over chips
 2. Put the "chip of gas mask" on a target chip.

If chip that is turn over is "chip of skull", you lose this round.
And it is "chip of peace", you gain 1 VP.

Players play 4 round and the player who have most VP is winner of this game!

Dicey Goblins is a press-your-luck dice game in which players take on the role of goblins stealing dragon eggs. The game is played in rounds, and each round consists of series of turns in which players decide whether they will attempt to raid the dragons lair or turn tail.

The game ends when a goblin (player) has collected at least 18 dragon eggs or you've played six rounds.

item.description: The game of random thinking! What crazy ideas fly out of your mouth when you're trying to make connections under pressure? Whatever they are. Randomonium will keep you and your friends laughing. Try to make as many connection between tiles as you can before the timer runs out. On your turn you have 20 seconds to link the words on your tiles to the tiles already played. You can be creative as you like, but your fellow players will decide if you play counts or not. Fast-paced and perfect for a crowd, Randomonium will put a smile on your face. Free association has never been so much fun!

Greedy Greedy Goblins is a simultaneous play, strategic tile placement and bluffing game.

Players lead a clan of goblin miners who want to gather the most valuable collection of gems. Coins are scored for gem tiles on the mines you have claimed, with bonuses for dynamite tiles — but if there is too much dynamite, the mine (and all the riches within) are destroyed!

In more detail, players sit around a circle composed of cave game boards and the guildhall game board, with sixty mining tiles placed face-down within this circle. Each round, while playing at the same time, players use one hand to look at one mining tile at a time, then place it on one of the cave game boards. At any time, a player can claim the guildhall or a cave by placing one of their three goblins on the board, after which no more tiles or goblins may be placed on this board.

Once everyone has placed all of their goblins (or decided not to place them), players resolve the boards. The goblin on the guildhall draws a minion card that provides a special ability, while each goblin in a cave scores coins based on the gems, diamonds, dynamite and monsters found there; these goblins can also take minion cards if minion tiles have been placed in the cave. Dynamite multiplies the value of a cave, but three or more sticks blows the place up, costing you coins.

If someone has one hundred or more coins, the game ends and whoever has the most coins wins; if not, set up another round and go digging again.

item.description:
Cubingos is played with large plastic cubes. Each face of the cubes has four creature halves on the edges. Game starts with one cube on the table. Each player takes a cube and a card is drawn, and players must now figure out a way to form the creature in the card by combining their cube with the starting cube.

The first player to figure out how yells "Cubingo" and places the cube on the table. If correct, the player gets the card as a point. Next round starts with a new card, now the newly-added cube can also be used to form creatures.

The design is credited for Chana Bergman / Theora Concept Ltd.

Peace has come at last to the great Bunny Kingdom! Lead your clan of rabbits to glory by gathering resources and building new cities across the land!

Draft cards and pick the right ones to position your warrens on the 100 squares of the board, provide resources to your colonies, build new cities to increase your influence, and plan your strategy to score big at the end of the game. Settle in lakesides or fields to collect water and grow carrots, gather mushrooms in the green forest, and climb the highest mountains to discover rare and precious resources... Secretly rally rabbit lords and recruit skillful masters to make your cities and resources even more valuable at the end of the game.

After each turn, your groups of contiguous warrens grant you points depending on the cities and different resources they include. The game ends after 4 turns, and the player with the most points wins the game.

item.description:
From the box (translated):

Try to beat your opponent in this lightning fast card game. Everybody tries to put down as quick as possible and in the right sequence: Toilet, Turd, Toilet Paper, Washing Hands (with no two cards of the same colour being allowed on top of each other). When a player has no more cards or cannot play anymore he hits the whoopie cushion. The player with the most cards left gets a fake turd (point) and a new round starts. The person with the fewest turds/points at the end of the game wins.


Players lay cards on the pile in the right colors and sequence: toilet, poo, wipe, and wash hands. As soon as a player is unable to play a card, they squeeze the whoopie cushion to end the round. The player with the most cards left must place a pile of poop on his head. After 5 rounds, the player with the most piles loses the game.

Game includes 5 poopy headband, whoopie cushion, 48 sequence cards and instructions.

item.description:
Up to 9 players can take part in a battle of wits, luck and skulduggery. Survive this cursed place through combat, agility or dungeon manipulation. Only the strongest, fastest and smartest will emerge victorious.

This isn’t your standard dungeon romp. The Living Dungeon has no ToHit rolls, no THACO, and no saving throws. Each player rolls their five chosen skill dice. They then have only 2 fretful minutes to decide what to do with those 5 actions. Panic will set in. The possibilities and threats will become overwhelming. Your mind will freeze up as your friends on different teams give you conflicting and misleading advice that you just can’t trust! Your time is running out, but there are just so many ways to die in The Living Dungeon.

Another player could hack you down! A wretched or a hybrid could maul you. You could fall down a bottomless pit, be crushed by a piston, be incinerated by a sentinel’s ever watchful flame, be torn to pieces by an incorporeal shadow, or flayed and consumed by the darkness its self. Choose wisely, as each move could be your last. 
There really is nothing quite like The Living Dungeon.

name.value: やさしい魔物と酒場の英雄 (Friendly Monsters and Tavern Heroes)

item.description: In ã‚„ã•ã—ã„é­”ç‰©ã¨é…’å ´ã®è‹±é›„ ("Friendly Monsters and Tavern Heroes", a.k.a. é­”ç‰©ã¨è‹±é›„ or "Monsters and Heroes"), players try to become a feudal lord over the four rounds of the game, building their territory to construct a city and boost their revenue. As they leverage their human resources and increase the number of actions they can do, they earn points toward victory.

From the back of the box:

Cloe, Yasmin, Sasha, Jade and the rest of the Bratz Pack need your fashion help to become runway ready! Flip over the cards, three at a time - and see what cool mix 'n' match outfit you can put together. If you have the most completed outfits by the end you're the winner!

The game is a memory variant and part of the Bratz franchise. Includes rules for solo play.

The playing area consists of four transparent square boards, made of ICI Perspex acrylic, each containing a 4 x 4 array of depressions. The boards are assembled prior to play, and using the 12 supplied Perspex support rods, in the form of a set of offset steps: the lowest is on the right and to the fore, the next one up is back a little and to the left, the next is at the back and to the right, and the highest is at back left. Each of the two players is allocated a pair of boards, a lower one and the upper one on the same side. Each player has 16 glass marbles (also referred to as 'pieces' or 'ollys') in his own colour (black or white) which he/she initially places in the depressions of his/her lower board. 
Each player's aim is to be the first to get four of their marbles on the opponent's lower board. Marbles move up to the owner's upper board, across to the opponent's upper board, and thence down to the opponent's lower board, governed by a set of rules stating what moves are permissible. When pieces move across to the opponent's upper board, it is possible to capture opposing marbles, and these may be taken back and re-entered when the opponent gets a marble into his/her target lower board. 
The game is one of pure strategy, with no randomising element, but has some similarities to Backgammon.


 The configurations of the boards may be varied slightly but this has no bearing on the game play.
 The game comes with a separate rule sheet for a solitaire version.
 An enclosed sheet states that "additional games will soon be available that can be played on the REFRACTION board, for 1, 2, or 4 players".
 The name of the game is spelled in capital letters throughout the box and printed enclosures.
 The following tag lines are used:
 The Ultimate Game
 The Three Dimensional Strategy Game Of The 21st Century
 The Game Of The 21st Century
 3D Game

name.value: Zeppelins: Monsters of the Purple Twilight

item.description:
For I dipt into the future, far as human eye could see,
Saw the Vision of the world, and all the wonder that would be;
Saw the heavens fill with commerce, argosies of magic sails,
Pilots of the purple twilight dropping down with costly bales;
Heard the heavens fill with shouting, and there rain'd a ghastly dew
From the nations' airy navies grappling in the central blue;

‘Locksley Hall’, Tennyson

This was the world’s first strategic bombing campaign, the first time death rained from the skies onto an unsuspecting populace. Although seemingly ponderous and fragile, and filled with inflammable hydrogen, in 1914 the airships built by Count Zeppelin for the fatherland were a much more viable platform to bomb the English than the rickety wood and canvas aeroplanes that struggled into the sky at the time. Able to fly for days and cover thousands of miles, they were a true ‘airy navy’. However, despite the conviction of its champion, the Leader of Airships Fgtkpt Peter Strasser, this Teutonic leviathan was not a war winning weapon, and failed to deliver the hoped-for victory.

Any reading of the campaign will show that their greatest challenge was not the British defences, but just finding their way over the British countryside. In the dark (all raids were at night), it all looks much the same, and there were no radio beams to guide them like in WWII. This is reflected in the game; above all it is a game of navigation.

The Zeppelin's movement is governed by a system that limits what you can do depending on how well you know your location. The latter you can improve by using landmarks, such as towns, rivers, railroads and coastlines. Alternatively, you can ignore these and rely on dead reckoning, but then you might end up totally lost in the middle of nowhere. And of course, there's weather (clouds, rain, mist) to frustrate you too. However, there's a chance of opportunistic targets when towns randomly fail to blackout.

However, it wasn’t only the Germans who faced the problems of the night. British aviation struggled to develop the technology and practice to deal with night raiders. A warning system that could enable timely launch of aeroplane patrols was never really developed, and once in the air the airman was on his own not knowing where the raider might be, or even where he was. Of course searchlights were the essential item to make the air defence viable, but the wily Zeppelin commander did all he could to avoid them, including using cloud cover.

This is similarly modelled in the game. The British player makes a hidden set up for his airfields before the German player comes on. Once the raiders arrive, he can launch aeroplane patrols, but the number and location is restricted by how much activity the raiders do to reveal themselves. Once launched, the patrol remains in place until a searchlit Zeppelin is in spotting range, and then it can attempt to intercept and attack. In the early scenarios aeroplane attacks can be damaging and cause a Zeppelin to scuttle home with leaks, but after incendiary ammunition was developed in mid 1916 it became sudden death to the Zeppelin.

The British player also has anti-aircraft guns, which are distributed over the map and controlled largely by random rolls, except for the mobile guns which the British player can place at strategic locations and use to set up ambushes.

Combat is largely abstracted to die rolls, but the challenge is to bring the raider to bear. As the British, you plan your fighter patrols and move mobile AA guns to defend areas or set up ambush. But reveal a unit too soon and the German player will know its there and avoid it. As the German, use stealth to avoid combat. Hide in clouds; at all costs keep out of those searchlights. But in the end, you have to brave them if you want to bomb the good targets.

This game offers a definitive study of that unusual campaign, with a set of 20 scenarios (each being an actual historical raid), covering the entire 4 years of the campaign. The subject matter naturally lends itself well to solitaire play as well, and specific rules for this are included.

name.value: 原始人の晩餐 (Supper of Primitive Man)

item.description: åŽŸå§‹äººã®æ™©é¤ (Supper of Primitive Man) makes you the head of a primitive tribe, and by hunting and gathering you can nourish that tribe, increasing its numbers and moving toward victory.

name.value: Black Eagles Over Belgium: Blucher vs. Napoleon, 1815

item.description:
Black Eagles Over Belgium: Blucher vs. Napoleon, 1815 is a hex-and-counter wargame covering the Belgium led battles taking place near Waterloo. The game includes three scenarios, the Battle of Ligny, the Battle of Wavre, and the Battle of Plancenoit. A combined campaign is also included with additional rules for movement between the maps.

Black Eagles Over Belgium uses a unique chit-pull mechanic that randomly determines turn length. Each turn, players will draw activation chits that allow a certain number of actions until each player has pulled an "End of Turn" chit and a third "End of Turn" chit is pulled. Players must optimize their actions because they never know when a turn is going to end. Some turns will be as short as 2 movement and combat phases and others could last 8 or 9 phases.
In ç¥žé“ (Shintoh), players are Shinto priests who participate in auctions.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Company: The Business Operation Card Game

item.description: In Company: The Business Operation Card Game, players can buy and sell goods in order to build their company — that is, their personal deck of cards. During the game, players must manage real estate cards that inflict regular maintenance costs on their owner, possibly causing severe cash flow issues during the company start-up section of each round.

name.value: Deer in the Headlights Board Game

item.description:
From the box:

"Players race to be the first to rid their hand of cards, win the round and dump max points on their opponents. But the action is ever-changing as players use their dice roll to pass 11-Point Bucks, avoid "Wolves", "Hunters" and "Cars," build RACKS and form alliances to slow down the winning players.

The addition of "Predator" cards and die, an interactive 3-fold game board and an oversize scoring grid add new strategies to gameplay and take Deer in the Headlights to a new level. 
The included camo bag neatly stores all game components for easy travel to any hunting or family event... after all, you wouldn't want to scare off any "wild game" in the area, would you?"

Differenzler or Differenz-Jass is a 3-4 player trick taking game in which players predict how many trick points they can win. It's popular enough to merit its own weekly TV show, Samschtig-Jass on Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen.

Mostly from David Parlett's The Penguin Book of Card Games:

Deal three batches of three cards to four players, or four batches of three to three players, and turn the last for trumps. Melds don't count, only-trick points, which are the usual 157. Each in turn [starting with Forehand] bids to win an exact number of trick-points. Play as at Handjass. And the end of play, each scores the difference between what he or she bid and what he or she took. The winner is the player with the lowest score after 12 deals. A player who fulfills his or her bid exactly deducts 10 points from his or her total, provided that he or she won at least one trick.

Variant: Players may instead keep their bids secret by writing them down.
